Are the two lobes of the hypandrium even in length?
answer: No - the right lobe extends to the tip or beyond the end of the epandrium (98).

question: Which statement best describes the end of the ovipositor?
answer: Simple in shape and with only short hairs (100).

Which statement best describes the end of the ovipositor?
answer: Long hairs ventrally (on the underside), and it has a pair of sub-terminal, dorsally projecting, thorn-like processes (99).
